intro: Hieracium florentinum subsp. anadenium, commonly known as the Florentine hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
